intro: [WRONG START] Elaeidendron confertiflorum, commonly known as the dense-flowered elaeodendron, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed.
